intro: Porroglossum schramii, commonly known as the Schram's porroglossum, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with a distinctive, narrow shape that distinguishes it from other members of the genus. Porroglossum schramii is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along coastal areas.
